```
conversation, I wanted to formally document to you, as I did
with Randy, that there are additional fees earned as a result
of my introducing you to other merchants that went to
CardConnect.
```

```
Declaration of John R. Isaacs

1.  I am over the age of 18 and am competent to testify to
the matters set forth herein, and I have personal knowledge of
such matters.

2. I am the Chief Executive Officer of Shift4 Payments, LLC
("Shift4")...

...[paragraphs about business operations]...

6. In 2014, Jeffrey Shavitz referred several merchants
to Shift4 who were seeking payment processing services.
These merchants included, inter alia, American Banknote
Corporation ("ABN"). Shift4 entered into an agreement to
provide payment processing services to ABN.
7. Mr. Shavitz and Shift4 agreed that Mr. Shavitz would
be paid a "finder's fee" of 17.5% of Shift4's net revenue
from the merchants he referred to Shift4.
8. There was no written agreement between Shift4 and
Mr. Shavitz memorializing this "finder's fee" agreement,
nor was there any cap or time limit on the finder's fees
to be paid to Mr. Shavitz.
9.  On or about July 10, 2015, Mr. Shavitz introduced Shift4's Founder,
 Randy Isaacs, to Jeffrey Shanahan,
President of CardConnect, via a telephone call.
...[paragraphs about the call]...
13. Shift4 commenced providing payment processing
services for the referred CardConnect Merchants in or around
October 2015.
14. Shift4 made payments to Mr. Shavitz as per the 17.5% finder's
fee agreement.
```

```
Deposition of John R. Isaacs
July 17, 2019
    A. He would call me, he would ask me if I
18 could find out a status, he would ask me if I could
19 see if it was paid, if -- he would say -- I would
20 say I would have to look. I remember vividly Taylor,
21 our controller, telling me to make sure he included a
22 merchant ID in the invoices when he would send them,
23 because a lot of times we didn't know what he was
24 actually looking for.
25 Q. Okay. And when you say the merchant ID --
```
